moves.3. e5 Bb7 4. Nc3 c5: Sounds suspicious, but... for the sake of making some pressure
moves.5. Nf3 cxd4 6. Nxd4 Nc6: (?) Maybe Bb4 was better , looking for a quick castling. Now Ndb5 creates a lot of pain in black´s defenses
moves.7. Nxc6 dxc6: But now I have that problem resolved.
moves.8. Bf4: Maybe ot the strongest position to play the bishop, but a safe move anyways
moves.8... Bb4 9. Bd2: Black has gained a time here.  9.Bd3 seems more active
moves.12. Qg4: ...but creates a strong attack on the kings side
moves.12... Nxc3: (!?) I found this move interesting, even after finishing the game. But it may have been a wrong one, since it seems white has compensation. At any rate, in a blitz game it is difficult to find the best defense. If 13,bxc3; O-O seems safe enough with a fair position for black.
moves.13. Qxg7 Rf8: I was looking for a rook´s sacrifice, moving queen outside, but saw no compensation, no mate or attack for the rook.
moves.14. bxc3 Qd5: With the idea of pressuring white´s castling and at the same time castling on the other side, with strong attack through g column.
moves.15. Bd3 O-O-O 16. O-O: MAybe too early, considering incoming attack. I thought 16. c4 saved the day for white. 16.Bxh7 seems too risky, but it may also do the job.
moves.16... Rfg8 17. Bc4: A mistake, but not easy to see
moves.17... Qxc4: Black threats Qxf1+, gaining the bishop for free if white´s is not taken to a safe place.
moves.18. Qxf7 c5: Bishop joins the attack. Black has the upper hand, can´t see a good defense for white.
moves.19. f3 Bd5: I was running out of time here, and though to keep safe e6, seeing nothing better, but maybe I should have added both rooks to the g column. Anyways, didn´t see Qa7, I reckon it was a lucky move for next sacrifice. I felt I had just given white a small chance to counterattack on my king´s wing.
moves.20. Qxa7: But I saw a nice combination
moves.20... Rxg2+: Beutiful. AS far as Bishop controls a8-h1, black seems safe enough and opening g column makes me look for a mate, which I didn´t see in sucha short period, but it seemed clear to me that white had no defense.
moves.21. Kxg2 Qe2+ 22. Kg3: I considered 22.Rf2, then  Rg8+ will make a quick check mate. But Kh3 was more a pain, since rook does not go to g with a check. But as I said before, as far as I have the bishop controlling h1-a8, I can prepare the attack carefully. Therefore, 22.Kh3, Rg8 threatening Qg2+ and mate should suffice. In case of 23. Rg1, then is mate with ...Qxf3+ 24. Rg3, Qa5++
moves.22... Rg8+ 23. Kh3 Qg2+: So, as a summary, not a great game (horrible opening), but an interesting and beautiful finish
